parks.name: Guy's & St Thomas' BRC
parks.notes: Major translational research hub co-located with Guy's Hospital. NHS/KCL partnership. DSP Toolkit environment.

parks.name: White City Innovation District
parks.notes: £3bn Imperial-anchored innovation district. MEDI+MAKER, Invention Rooms. White City Place commercial campus adjacent.

parks.name: King's Cross Life Sciences Hub
parks.notes: Former office conversion to life sciences space. Adjacent to Francis Crick Institute.

parks.name: Francis Crick Institute
parks.notes: Europe's largest single-site biomedical research facility. 1,500 scientists. Major anchor for London life sciences.

parks.name: Here East
parks.notes: Former Olympic press/broadcast centre. Home to BT Sport, Loughborough University London, UCL East, Ford Smart Mobility.

parks.name: East Bank (UCL East / V&A / Sadler's Wells)
parks.notes: Major cultural and educational development. UCL East open from 2024. V&A East and Sadler's Wells to follow.

parks.name: London BioScience Innovation Centre
parks.notes: Co-located with Royal Veterinary College and Camden BioMedical Campus. Strong MRC links.

parks.name: Surrey Research Park
parks.notes: Founded 1985, co-founded UKSPA. 170 acres, home to SSTL (Surrey Satellite Technology). vHive animal health incubator. 2024 UKSPA award winner.

parks.name: Southampton Science Park
parks.notes: 180 acres, strong University of Southampton links. Home to Promega UK HQ. Recent sustainability-led refurbishment programme.

parks.name: Langstone Technology Park
parks.notes: Established tech park with strong defence sector presence. Close to Portsmouth naval base.

parks.name: University of Reading Science & Technology Centre
parks.notes: Strong agri-food and environmental science focus. Links to BBSRC-funded research at Reading.

parks.name: Discovery Park
parks.notes: Former Pfizer global R&D campus. 3m sq ft. Enterprise Zone. Major life sciences cluster.

parks.name: Kent Science Park
parks.notes: One of the UK's longest-established science parks. Strong pharma and life sciences focus.

parks.name: University of Essex Research Park
parks.notes: Links to Essex Data Analytics research. Growing AI and computational science cluster.

parks.name: Bristol & Bath Science Park
parks.sector: Digital, Creative, Life Sciences, Advanced Engineering
parks.notes: 110 acres. National Composites Centre nearby. Strong West of England Combined Authority support.

parks.name: Future Space
parks.notes: Deep tech incubator co-located with BBSP. High-tech labs, cleanrooms. Strong aerospace and quantum computing links.

parks.name: Bath Quays North Innovation
parks.notes: Regeneration-led innovation hub in central Bath. University of Bath proximity.

parks.name: Exeter Science Park
parks.notes: Strong environmental science and Met Office links. Growing space tech cluster.

parks.name: Plymouth Science Park
parks.notes: Strong marine technology and defence focus. Close to DSTL and Plymouth University.

parks.name: Electronics & Photonics Innovation Centre (EPIC)
parks.notes: Specialist electronics and photonics hub serving South Devon advanced manufacturing sector.

parks.name: Dorset Innovation Park
parks.notes: Former nuclear research site (UKAEA). Strong energy and nuclear decommissioning expertise. Enterprise Zone.

parks.name: Porton Down / Porton Science Park
parks.notes: Sensitive defence R&D site. Porton Biopharma spinout park adjacent. High biosecurity environment.

parks.name: ARC Oxford (Brookfield)
parks.notes: £1bn+ regeneration. 3,500+ community members. Largest innovation community in Oxford. Flexible workspace model.

parks.name: Oxford Science Park
parks.notes: Magdalen College development. 600,000 sq ft expansion by 2026. Strong pharma and biotech cluster.

parks.name: Oxford North Innovation District
parks.operator: St John's College / Thomas White Oxford
parks.notes: £1.2bn development. Minister for Science endorsed. 480,000 sq ft lab/office planned. Major Arc anchor investment.

parks.name: Begbroke Science Park
parks.notes: University of Oxford early-stage spinout incubator. Strong materials science and engineering focus.

parks.name: Oxford Technology Park
parks.notes: 400,000 sq ft. Premium lab and office campus north of Oxford. Strong bio and tech sector mix.

parks.name: BioEscalator
parks.notes: University of Oxford biomedical incubator. Flexible wet lab provision for early-stage spinouts. Strong IP pipeline.

parks.name: Milton Park
parks.notes: One of Europe's largest business parks. 9,000 people, 270+ companies. Major life sciences cluster. Oxford Biomedica, RM, others.

parks.name: Harwell Campus
parks.sector: Space, Nuclear, Energy, Computing, Life Sciences
parks.notes: National science campus. 5m sq ft masterplan. Home to STFC, Diamond Light Source, ISIS Neutron Source, Space Park. UK's most successful science campus (UKSPA 2024).

parks.name: Abingdon Science Park
parks.notes: Compact life sciences park proximate to Milton Park. Primarily medical devices and diagnostics.

parks.name: Culham Campus
parks.notes: UKAEA fusion energy research site. Home to ITER UK, Tokamak Energy, First Light Fusion. UK's leading fusion energy cluster.

parks.name: Bicester Motion
parks.notes: Future mobility innovation campus on former RAF Bicester. Automotive, aerospace, EV, autonomous vehicles. Heritage and cutting-edge mix.

parks.name: Cranfield University Technology Park
parks.notes: Only UK university with its own airfield and airport. Aerospace and automotive engineering hub. Proximity to Mercedes AMG F1.

parks.name: Silverstone Technology Cluster
parks.notes: Heart of the UK's Motorsport Valley. F1 teams, Cosworth, aerodynamics, composites. Growing defence tech cluster.

parks.name: Bletchley Park / NCSC-linked Innovation
parks.notes: Growing cybersecurity cluster around Milton Keynes leveraging Bletchley Park heritage and NCSC proximity.

parks.name: Stevenage Bioscience Catalyst
parks.sector: Life Sciences, Cell & Gene Therapy, Pharma
parks.notes: Life Sciences Opportunity Zone. Co-located with GSK Global R&D and Cell & Gene Therapy Catapult. Premier UK cell therapy cluster.

parks.name: Elevate Quarter Stevenage
parks.notes: 1.6m sq ft planned — one of Europe's largest life science campuses. Planning approved 2024. Adjacent to GSK and Bioscience Catalyst.

parks.name: BioPark Hertfordshire
parks.notes: University of Hertfordshire-operated life sciences incubator. Good proximity to London and Cambridge.

parks.name: Colworth Science Park
parks.notes: Former Unilever R&D site. Strong food science and FMCG focus. Unique sector positioning within Arc.

parks.name: Cambridge Science Park
parks.sector: ICT, Deep Tech, AI, Life Sciences
parks.notes: UK's first science park (1970). 130+ companies including Darktrace, Qualcomm, Samsung, Raspberry Pi. 30,000 sq ft expansion planned.

parks.name: St John's Innovation Centre
parks.notes: Long-established incubator. 80+ firms. Strong early-stage and spinout focus. SETsquared partner.

parks.name: Peterhouse Technology Park
parks.notes: Arm Holdings anchor tenant. 350,000 sq ft. Semiconductor and chip design cluster.

parks.name: Cambridge Research Park Waterbeach
parks.notes: Out-of-city campus on A10 corridor. Growing lab and office provision. Near planned Waterbeach new town.

parks.name: Melbourn Science Park
parks.notes: 390,000 sq ft Bruntwood SciTech redevelopment. Growing life sciences cluster. Strong diagnostics sector.

parks.name: TusPark Cambridge
parks.notes: Part of global Tsinghua University science park network. China-UK innovation bridge. AI and biotech focus.

parks.name: Cambridge Biomedical Campus
parks.operator: Multiple (NHS Trust, University of Cambridge, AstraZeneca)
parks.notes: Europe's largest medical research campus. Addenbrooke's, Royal Papworth, AstraZeneca HQ, Cancer Research UK, New Cambridge South station under construction.

parks.name: Babraham Research Campus
parks.notes: Bench-to-business model. £1.2bn investment attracted. Strong immunology, epigenetics, metabolomics. 60+ biomedical orgs.

parks.name: Granta Park
parks.notes: 160 acres. Premium life sciences campus. Illumina, Gilead, Napp, Axol Bioscience. Managed service model.

parks.name: Wellcome Genome Campus
parks.notes: World-leading genomics hub. Sanger Institute sequenced 1/3 of first human genome. 440-acre expansion with hundreds of millions of Wellcome investment.

parks.name: Chesterford Research Park
parks.notes: 250 acres. Charles River, Illumina. 3 miles from Wellcome Genome Campus. Enterprise Zone.

parks.name: Cambourne Park
parks.notes: 60+ companies including Carl Zeiss, MediaTek. Life Science REIT-managed. Growing medtech cluster west of Cambridge.

parks.name: Unity Campus
parks.notes: Boutique science campus south of Cambridge. Early-stage and spinout focus. Sustainable design ethos.

parks.name: South Cambridge Science Centre
parks.notes: Emerging campus. 145,000 sq ft Phase 1. Net Zero target. Life sciences and clean tech focus.

parks.name: Norwich Research Park
parks.notes: Europe's leading agri-food and environmental research cluster. John Innes Centre, Sainsbury Lab, Earlham Institute, Quadram Institute all on-site.

parks.name: BioCity Nottingham
parks.notes: Major life sciences incubator. MediCity co-located. Strong pharma cluster. Boots, AstraZeneca alumni.

parks.name: MediCity Nottingham
parks.notes: Medical devices and diagnostics specialist. MHRA proximity. NHS digital health innovation.

parks.name: Nottingham Science and Technology Park
parks.notes: University of Nottingham-linked park. Strong engineering and ICT focus.

parks.name: University of Nottingham Innovation Park
parks.notes: On-campus innovation park. Close links to Boots Centre for Pharmacy. Strong pharmaceutical research.

parks.name: Loughborough University Science & Enterprise Park
parks.notes: Adjacent to 2012 Olympic legacy facility. Sports technology and advanced materials cluster. Home to National Centre for Sport and Exercise Medicine.

parks.name: Leicester Innovation Hub
parks.notes: Space science focus — University of Leicester built instruments for Mars/space missions. Growing digital innovation cluster.

parks.name: Birmingham Research Park
parks.notes: University of Birmingham-linked park. Growing health tech cluster. Proximity to Queen Elizabeth Hospital Birmingham.

parks.name: Birmingham Science Park Aston
parks.notes: City-centre innovation district. Strong digital and creative sector. Aston University proximity.

parks.name: Arden Cross
parks.notes: £3.2bn mixed-use development adjacent to Birmingham Airport and HS2 Interchange. MOU with UHB and University of Warwick for medical campus.

parks.name: University of Warwick Science Park
parks.notes: Major Midlands innovation hub. Three sites: Coventry, Warwick, and Blythe Valley. Strong automotive and engineering cluster. Wellesbourne Campus.

parks.name: Coventry University Technology Park
parks.notes: City-centre innovation hub. Strong EV and connected vehicles focus. MTC proximity.

parks.name: Keele University Science & Innovation Park
parks.notes: 70 acres. 2024 UKSPA Sustainability Award winner. Smart energy campus — first net zero-ready science park. Keele Innovation District in development.

parks.name: Staffordshire Technology Park
parks.notes: Established technology park serving Staffordshire's engineering and defence sectors.

parks.name: Malvern Hills Science Park
parks.notes: QinetiQ and GCHQ proximity. Strong cyber and defence electronics cluster. Radar and electronic warfare expertise.

parks.name: Wolverhampton Science Park
parks.notes: Creative Industries Centre celebrated 20th anniversary 2024. Strong digital and advanced manufacturing focus.

parks.name: Manchester Science Park
parks.notes: City-centre innovation quarter. Citylabs 1.0 and Citylabs 2.0 life sciences. STEAMhouse. Atom Valley initiative nearby.

parks.name: Alderley Park
parks.notes: Former AstraZeneca global R&D campus. 400 acres, largest single-site life science campus outside London. Biotech catalyst hub.

parks.name: Liverpool Science Park
parks.operator: Liverpool City Council / University of Liverpool
parks.notes: Knowledge Quarter Liverpool. Strong life sciences. University of Liverpool and Liverpool John Moores proximity.

parks.name: Liverpool Innovation Park
parks.notes: City-based innovation park. Growing digital cluster. Edge Hill / LJMU proximity.

parks.name: MerseyBio
parks.notes: Specialist biotech incubator. Early-stage biotech and life sciences focus. Strong University of Liverpool links.

parks.name: Sci-Tech Daresbury
parks.sector: AI, Quantum, Industrial Biotech, Health Tech
parks.notes: National science campus. Home to STFC Hartree Centre (HPC/AI), national quantum hub. 120+ companies. Liverpool City Region anchor.

parks.name: The Heath Business & Technical Park
parks.notes: Former ICI chemicals research site. Strong environmental and industrial chemistry cluster.

parks.name: Lancaster Science Park
parks.notes: Lancaster University-linked campus. Health innovation and environmental science focus.

parks.name: Westlakes Science & Technology Park
parks.notes: Sellafield proximity. Nuclear decommissioning and new nuclear tech. Unique sector concentration.

parks.name: Leeds Innovation Centre
parks.operator: University of Leeds / Leeds City Council
parks.notes: City-centre innovation hub. University of Leeds proximity. Strong health innovation and digital cluster. Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust nearby.

parks.name: Sheffield Technology Parks
parks.notes: 2-year Innovation Spine project underway (2024). Collaboration: Sheffield/Hallam universities, City Council, SYMCA. Major city-centre innovation corridor in planning.

parks.name: Advanced Manufacturing Innovation District (AMID)
parks.notes: Home to AMRC (Boeing-funded), Nuclear AMRC, Royce Institute. National centre for advanced manufacturing and aerospace.

parks.name: York Science Park
parks.notes: Strong University of York links. Biorenewables Development Centre, Plasma Research Centre, Nanocentre. N8 Research Partnership member.

parks.name: National Agri-Food Innovation Campus
parks.notes: UK's leading agri-food innovation campus. Biorenewables focus. Strong DEFRA and BBSRC links.

parks.name: Wilton Centre
parks.notes: Former ICI research site. Process industry and energy focus. Teesside industrial cluster.

parks.name: Newlands Science Park
parks.notes: University of Hull-linked. Growing offshore wind and renewables cluster. Hull's status as UK City of Culture 2017 drove creative digital growth.

parks.name: Newcastle Helix
parks.sector: Data Science, Life Sciences, AI, Digital Health
parks.notes: £350m city-centre innovation district. National Innovation Centre for Data, National Innovation Centre for Ageing. Strong AI and health data focus.

parks.name: NETPark (North East Technology Park)
parks.notes: STFC-linked. Strong biotech, photonics and precision engineering cluster. Durham University proximity.

parks.name: Sunderland Software City / Science Complex
parks.notes: Software City initiative. Strong digital and manufacturing focus. University of Sunderland proximity.

parks.name: BioQuarter Edinburgh
parks.operator: University of Edinburgh / NHS Lothian / Scottish Enterprise
parks.notes: Scotland's leading life sciences campus. Co-located with Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh. ClinTec, Synpromics, 4D Pharma alumni.

parks.name: Heriot-Watt University Research Park
parks.notes: Strong engineering, energy and robotics focus. National Robotarium on-campus. Growing data science cluster.

parks.name: Edinburgh Technopole
parks.notes: Periurban Edinburgh campus. Strong environmental science and agri-tech focus.

parks.name: Pentlands Science Park
parks.notes: Agri/vet science focused campus. Strong Moredun links for animal health research.

parks.name: Roslin BioCentre
parks.notes: Home of Dolly the Sheep research. World-leading animal genomics. Earlham Institute-linked. Strong biomedical foundation.

parks.name: Elvingston Science Centre
parks.notes: Small specialist agri-tech campus in East Lothian.

parks.name: BioCity Glasgow
parks.notes: Glasgow's leading life sciences incubator. Proximity to University of Glasgow and Strathclyde. Growing CGT cluster.

parks.name: West of Scotland Science Park
parks.notes: Established Glasgow innovation campus. Strong university links. Proximity to Queen Elizabeth University Hospital.

parks.name: Hillington Park Innovation Centre
parks.notes: Large industrial and innovation park. Advanced manufacturing and engineering cluster.

parks.name: Scottish Enterprise Technology Park
parks.notes: Established technology park south of Glasgow. Advanced manufacturing and engineering focus.

parks.name: Ayrshire Innovation Centre
parks.notes: West of Scotland innovation hub serving Ayrshire businesses.

parks.name: Dundee Medipark
parks.sector: Life Sciences, Medical Devices, Digital Health
parks.notes: Strong medical device and digital health focus. University of Dundee world-leading in drug discovery.

parks.name: Dundee Technology Park
parks.notes: Adjacent to Medipark. Mixed digital and life sciences. Video games industry cluster (Grand Theft Auto origin).

parks.name: Stirling University Innovation Park
parks.notes: Health sciences and environmental management focus. University of Stirling Management School proximity.

parks.name: Tweed Horizons
parks.notes: Rural innovation centre serving Scottish Borders businesses.

parks.name: Aberdeen Science Parks (Incubator/Campus)
parks.sector: Energy, Oil & Gas Tech, Marine, Life Sciences
parks.operator: University of Aberdeen / Aberdeen City Council
parks.notes: Strong energy technology cluster. Oil and gas decommissioning tech. Transition to offshore wind and hydrogen.

parks.name: Cardiff Business Technology Centre
parks.notes: Cardiff University proximity. Growing creative digital and life sciences cluster.

parks.name: Cardiff Edge
parks.notes: Life sciences focus. Strong Cardiff University links. Wales Centre for Health links.

parks.name: Menai Science Park (M-SParc)
parks.notes: Wales's first bilingual (Welsh/English) science park. Marine energy, offshore wind, environmental tech. Remote Island innovation hub.

parks.name: Catalyst Belfast
parks.notes: Northern Ireland's leading innovation campus. 100+ companies. 1,200+ employees. Strong fintech and cybersecurity cluster. Republic of Ireland gateway.

parks.name: Ulster Science & Technology Park
parks.notes: Ulster University-linked campus. Digital and life sciences focus.

parks.name: University of Ulster Science Research Parks (Jordanstown/Magee)
parks.notes: Multiple campus sites. Digital and engineering focus. Cross-border innovation potential.
